text:
As many as 356 youths found placements at a job fair organised under the Tamil Nadu State Rural Livelihood Mission at the Montfort Matric Higher Secondary School at Manapparai on Saturday. About 584 youths participated in the fair meant for Manapparai, Marungapuri and Vaiyampatti panchayat unions. Twenty-one private companies participated to recruit candidates. District Collector K.S.Palanisamy handed over the offer letters to the selected candidates.

Survey of people

carrying night soil

A survey to identify persons involved in removing night soil and their dependents was currently under way in the city. This is a follow up to the survey conducted in 2014 and the present exercise was meant to identify omitted persons. Those involved in activities such as cleaning unhygienic toilets, open drains, septic tanks, and removal of night soil on railway tracks can appear at the zonal offices at Srirangam, Ariyaman galam, Golden Rock and K. Abishekapuram in the city between February 22 and 24, Corporation Commissioner M. Vijayalakshmi said in a press release.
title: 356 candidates get jobs at fair
